intro: Bogoria taeniorhiza, commonly known as the African waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in wetland and marshy environments, often growing in shallow water or moist soil. It has a creeping rootstock and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Bogoria taeniorhiza is also known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
